title: Fulfillment Center Human Resources Business Partner
content:
Our Opportunity: 
Chewy is recruiting for a Human Resources Business Partner at our Belton, MO fulfillment center. This position coordinates and is responsible for the Fulfillment Center Human Resources department. If you are looking for a role in which no two days are the same and employee engagement is a high priority – this position is for you! Chewy is a thriving organization, and our team members are a valued asset. We need an expert HR Leader to join our team.  
(Day shift Monday-Friday) 
What you'll do: 

Lead the team responsible for performance management, employee engagement, and talent development.
Assist management staff in the resolution of issues and concerns, which may include disciplinary action. 
Assist with training as needed and develop a team responsible for a best-in-class onboarding experience. 
Collaborate with the Total Rewards organization to build and maintain compensation programs, evaluate job levels, and ensure compensation programs remain competitive. 
Administer worker's compensation program: investigate all injuries, first aid, and near misses, and work with plant management to reduce all three. 
Handle benefits administration.
Develop/update job descriptions, rules, procedures, and policies as needed. 
Participate in facility safety and meetings, including, but not limited to, safety committee meetings and accident investigations. 

What you'll need: 

Bachelor's degree in business administration, human resources, or related field of study, or the equivalent experience in a similar warehouse or fulfillment environment. 
5 years in an HR partnership role, ideally within a fulfillment or distribution center. 
2 years of experience leading an HR Team.
Consistent track record of strategic partnerships which enhance the HR experience. 
Desire to work in a lively work environment with a demonstrable track record of success. 
Excellent written, verbal, and public presentation /communication skills and strong interpersonal skills. 
Able to work optimally with a variety of personnel.
Strong employee relations background.
The position may require travel.
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
